result.execSummary:
The defendant David Alvin Fonstad was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property (Over $2500) [Modifiers: property value], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(2)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Unpaid Court Ordered Financial Obligations Converted to a Civil Judgment

supervisions.notes: 51 days sentence credit, if the defendant is revoked in the future.  In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Restitution Ordered:  $785.58 - Tremp. Co. Sheriff's Dept.; $500.00 - Independence Fire Department;  G.W. - $300.00; $158.56 - surcharge.  Bond money is to be applied.  The defendant is to work out a payment plan with the Agent to pay the balance.
The defendant is to pay court costs and DOC fees.
The defendant is to have an AODA assessment and comply with it.
The defendant is to have a Psychological Evaluation.  This evaluation is to be done within the next 90 days.

The defendant is to have no contact with E.S. and his property.  The defendant is to have no contact with M.H., except at family events with other adults present.  The defendant is to have no contact with anyone he knows to be a drug user or drug dealer.
The defendant is to pay any child support obligations he has, including both current and arrears.

The defendant is to have a Domestic Violence assessment and comply with any recommendations.  The defendant is to take his medications as directed by his doctor.  The defendant has a curfew for the next 60 days.  The curfew is from 10:00 pm - 5:00 am daily.  The Agent may modify the curfew as necessary.  The defendant is to provide a DNA sample.    The defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  The defendant is to have any other evaluations the Agent feels is appropriate and comply with the recommendations.
